Loveland.Campion, Colorado: Campion is an unincorporated community in Larimer County, Colorado, United States. The population was 1,832 at the 2000 census, at which time it was a census-designated place (CDP); the community was not enumerated separately in the 2010 census. Located between Loveland and Berthoud along U.S. Route 287, it was named for John F. Campion, a railroad official.
